review.body:
Where oh where did Christine go

As the series has progressed more sex has crept in and less story. My favorite all time series has diminished into repetitive sex scenes and shrinking storyline. Trixie's story saved the whole book and kept it from being a waste of time. Even though Aleksei needed a...
It went on too long for me.

Wow

I am surprised that Helen Harper has not been nabbed by a big book company . Her stories are farrrr better then a few of the big shots I have read . Strange . Makes me wonder . Well , keep writing Helen karma is not a bitch .

I loved the Q&A a Day: 5 Year Journal by Potter Style and have been using it every day for over a year. So, when I saw this was available for free in exchange for a review on Blogging for Books, I knew I had to request it. This journal is very interesting, and in the sort of style of Wreck Th...

I can't begin to describe how much I enjoyed reading this novel. It caught my attention from the very first page and held me in its grip until the fabulous ending.

A plague is raging through the French town of Lucie-sur-Vionne leaving death and destruction in its wake. Heloise, the illegitimate d...
This is an interactive book, and great for kids who are learning how to count.
This book fills my heart with happiness. (And not only because there is a narwhal in the end.)

Mr. Ferris and His Wheel is a story about George Washington Gale Ferris Jr. creating the Ferris Wheel. After the French create the Eiffle tower, there is pressure on the Americans to create something even better. George is motivated to create this monster wheel but no one else is supporting him....

book.title: Nine Parts of Desire: The Hidden World of Islamic Women

review.body: Educational and upsetting. her voice lulled me to sleep... very hard to get through it.
This book was great.

book.title: Dave the Potter: Artist, Poet, Slave
book.publisher: Little, Brown Books for Young Readers

review.body: This book is about a man who was a former slave who now works as a potter making beautiful clay vases and dishes.
If you are going through a tough time or even if you are looking for a good spiritual pick me up. This book is recommended for anyone who could use a little hope.

book.title: The Confidence Game: Why We Fall for It . . . Every Time

review.body: An amazing book that every marketer should read... Definitely one of the best I've read in 2016!!!

Solar storms and extreme flooding leave only a few human survivors banded together on a flotilla of various size ships and boats. They fight a deadly virus which causes the person to become violent by bathing with salt and wearing facial masks tinged with salt. Supplies gathered from the ships an...

I absolutely loved this book. I could so easily identify with the characters and I fell in love immediately with the charm of the island. Every book, regardless of which series it is, makes me fall into the setting and I feel like I am a part of the town, and I love that Melissa Foster can create...

Disappointingly appropriative at best. Seemed to be attempting to critique orientalism and racism in fantasy, but often ended up perpetuating. Pratchett occasionally fails in this manner in other books, but none (that I have so far read) so wholly.

book.title: Leontyne Price: Voice of a Century

review.body: Leontyne Price: Voice of a Century is a picture book biography based on an African American opera singer, Leontyne Price. She was the first African American opera singer to be featured on American television and played a large role in other large-scale opera performances. Price was born with a lo...

book.title: Fervent: A Woman's Battle Plan to Serious, Specific and Strategic Prayer

review.body: While I like the idea of taking about prayer and spiritual warfare, this book wasn't practical enough for me. It was broken down into 10 part of your life the enemy likes to attack. It just got a little monotonous.

book.title: Forced Behind Bars - The Complete Series

review.body: Erotic and extremely sexy, surprisingly good story line it was a good read all around. Author should definitely keep writing with nice story lines like this one.

In Dark Pants Number One, artist Matt MacFarland gives us a fast paced, page-turning narrative. The illustrations in the graphic novel are stunning. Combine the words with the pictures and you get a small treasure of a book that you can read over and over, noticing some new detail or nuance every...
